meanings.definition: The quality or state of being worthy
meanings.sent1: Her worthinesses shone through when she helped the elderly lady cross the street.
meanings.sent2: The team captain's worthinesses were evident in the way he always put the team first.
meanings.sent3: His worthinesses to be called a hero were tested when he rescued the cat stuck in the tree.
meanings.sent4: The worthinesses of her character were like a bright light in a dark room.
meanings.sent5: The worthinesses of the award winner were celebrated by the whole community.

meanings.sent1: The puppy's worthinesses of a treat was clear as it wagged its tail happily.
meanings.sent2: The student's worthinesses of praise was acknowledged by the teacher for their hard work.
meanings.sent3: The worthinesses of the cake to be eaten was debated by the siblings.
meanings.sent4: The worthinesses of the charity to receive donations was unquestionable.
meanings.sent5: The worthinesses of the painting to be displayed in the gallery was decided by the curator.
